content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to describe a target word for another player to guess.

Rules:
(a) You have to reply in the form: CLUE: <some text>. Guesses from the other player will start with GUESS.
(b) You cannot use the target word itself, parts or morphological variants of it in your description.
(c) In addition, the same rules apply for related words which are provided below.

End conditions:
(i) If you use the target word or a related word in your description, then you lose.
(ii) If the other player can guess the target word in 3 tries, you both win.

Let us start.

This is the target word that you need to describe and that the other player needs to guess:

debug

Related words are:

- correct
- electronic
- bug

Important: You are under time pressure, give short descriptions that are to the point!

content.thinking:
I need to describe the word "debug" without using any of these words:
- debug (the target word)
- correct
- electronic
- bug

I also need to keep my clue short and to the point since we're under time pressure.

"Debug" generally refers to the process of finding and removing errors or problems in a computer program or system. Let me think of ways to describe this concept:

- Fix issues in programs
- Remove errors from code
- Troubleshoot software problems
- Find and solve coding mistakes
- The process of identifying and removing flaws in computer software

I need to be careful to avoid using words like "correct" (since fixing is about correcting), "electronic" (since debugging is often done with electronic systems), and especially "bug" (which is part of the word "debug" itself).

Let me craft a concise clue:

"CLUE: Find and remove errors in computer programs"

This describes the concept of debugging without using any of the forbidden words. The clue is straightforward and to the point.

content.text: CLUE: Find and remove errors in computer programs.

clem_player.response: CLUE: Find and remove errors in computer programs.

content.text:
You are playing a collaborative word guessing game in which you have to guess a target word that another player describes to you.

You can make one guess at each trial. You win when you guess the target word. You lose when you cannot guess it in 3 tries.

After each trial you will get a new hint from the other player which starts with CLUE.

Make your guesses by just saying the word using the following form: GUESS: <a word>

Let us start.


CLUE: Find and remove errors in computer programs.

content.thinking:
The clue is asking me to guess a word related to "Find and remove errors in computer programs."

When we find and remove errors in computer programs, we are:
- Debugging
- Troubleshooting
- Fixing
- Testing
- Resolving

Among these options, "debugging" is the most specific term for the process of finding and removing errors (bugs) in computer programs. So my first guess will be "debugging".

Let me go with "debugging" as my first guess.
